debs15.dkg_storm.builder

Class DKGBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • debs15.dkg_storm.builder.DKGBuilder

  • public class DKGBuilder
extends Object
    Author:
    Nicolo Rivetti This class implements the learning and building phase of DKG

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DKGBuilder(double theta, double epsilonFactor, int k, double factor) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      DKGHash build()
      Returns a DKGHash objects that encapsulate a close the optimal mapping built given the updates from the learning phase.
      void newSample(int key)
      Updates DKG's data structures with key, ie, performs the learning phase of DKG.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • DKGBuilder

        public DKGBuilder(double theta,
          double epsilonFactor,
          int k,
          double factor)
        Parameters:
        theta - double value in (0,1], heavy hitter threshold, i.e., all keys with an empirical probability larger than or equal to theta belong to the heavy hitter set.
        epsilonFactor - defines the ration between the Space Saving's Heavy Hitter threshold theta and precision parameter epsilon: epsilon = theta / epsilonFactor.
        k - the number of available instances
        factor - double value >=1, set the number of buckets of sparse items to factor * k (number of available instances).

    • Method Detail

      • newSample

        public void newSample(int key)
        Updates DKG's data structures with key, ie, performs the learning phase of DKG.
        Parameters:
        key -

      • build

        public DKGHash build()
        Returns a DKGHash objects that encapsulate a close the optimal mapping built given the updates from the learning phase.
        Returns:
        a DKGHash object thath encapsulates DKG's global mapping (Heavy Hitters to operator instances and buckets of Sparse Items to instances)
